title: WIP: Use structured logging for DB load balancer
description:
## What does this MR do?

<!--

Describe in detail what your merge request does and why.

Are there any risks involved with the proposed change? What additional
test coverage is introduced to offset the risk?

Please keep this description up-to-date with any discussion that takes
place so that reviewers can understand your intent. This is especially
important if they didn't participate in the discussion.

-->

Relates to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ee/issues/13547 and https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ee/issues/13548

## Does this MR meet the acceptance criteria?

### Conformity

- [ ] [Changelog entry](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/changelog.html) 
- [ ] [Documentation created/updated](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/documentation/feature-change-workflow.html) or [follow-up review issue created](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ce/issues/new?issuable_template=Doc%20Review)

If this MR contains changes to processing or storing of credentials or tokens, authorization and authentication methods and other items described in [the security review guidelines](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/security/#when-to-request-a-security-review):

- [ ] The MR includes necessary changes to maintain consistency between UI, API, email, or other methods
- [ ] Security reports checked/validated by a reviewer from the AppSec team

title: WIP: Implement public MR-level approval rules API
description:
## What does this MR do?

Add API endpoints so API users can list, create, update and delete MR-level approval rules.

The following API endpoints are added:
- `GET /projects/:id/merge_requests/:merge_request_iid/approval_rules`
- `POST /projects/:id/merge_requests/:merge_request_iid/approval_rules`
- `PUT /projects/:id/merge_requests/:merge_request_iid/approval_rules/:approval_rule_id`
- `DELETE /projects/:id/merge_requests/:merge_request_iid/approval_rules/:approval_rule_id`

## Does this MR meet the acceptance criteria?

### Conformity

- [ ] [Changelog entry](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/changelog.html) 
- [ ] [Documentation created/updated](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/documentation/feature-change-workflow.html) or [follow-up review issue created](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ce/issues/new?issuable_template=Doc%20Review)

#12055

title: Log in Prometheus current number of host and index
description:
## What does this MR do?

1. Log current number of hosts and current index when `#initialize` is called
1. Log current number of hosts and current index when `#next` is called
1. Log current number of hosts and current index when `#hosts=` is called

https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ee/issues/13630

title: WIP: Add purchase point to group billing page
description:
## What does this MR do?

<!--

Describe in detail what your merge request does and why.

Are there any risks involved with the proposed change? What additional
test coverage is introduced to offset the risk?

Please keep this description up-to-date with any discussion that takes
place so that reviewers can understand your intent. This is especially
important if they didn't participate in the discussion.

-->

Adds Billing Plans to top-level `groups/billing` route.
Changes Billing Plan table to Card layout as per https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ce/issues/63599

Top-level `groups/billing`
![groups-billing-plans-cards](/uploads/d6a636af7f6d5ba341bfec0d1375f8ea/groups-billing-plans-cards.png)

`profile/billing`
![profile-billing-plans-cards](/uploads/fa6de1e12b07423573d38af0f523004b/profile-billing-plans-cards.png)

Closes https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ce/issues/63599

title: Quarantine failing test
description:
## What does this MR do?

The elasticsearch test fails because it uses a license file as a template, and the template is missing.

See https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/quality/nightly/issues/127

title: Remove the store_designs_in_lfs feature flag
description:
## What does this MR do?

This MR removes the `store_designs_in_lfs` feature flag from the codebase. 

Issue https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ee/issues/12158.

The feature flag was added in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ee/merge_requests/13389. 

This MR does not include a changelog entry, because the feature has been enabled by default since https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ee/merge_requests/13389 and that MR contained the changelog.

title: Resolve "Broken master - Job Failed #275548923"
description:
## What does this MR do?

Regenerate gitlab pot file

```diff
diff --git a/locale/gitlab.pot b/locale/gitlab.pot
index 816f4a2590c..6dc4e4b6bc4 100644
--- a/locale/gitlab.pot
+++ b/locale/gitlab.pot
@@ -10705,6 +10705,9 @@ msgstr ""
 msgid "Pipelines for last year"
 msgstr ""
 
+msgid "Pipelines for merge requests are configured. A detached pipeline runs in the context of the merge request, and not against the merged result. Learn more on the documentation for Pipelines for Merged Results."
+msgstr ""
+
 msgid "Pipelines settings for '%{project_name}' were successfully updated."
 msgstr ""
 
@@ -14746,9 +14749,6 @@ msgstr ""
 msgid "The character highlighter helps you keep the subject line to %{titleLength} characters and wrap the body at %{bodyLength} so they are readable in git."
 msgstr ""
 
-msgid "The code of a detached pipeline is tested against the source branch instead of merged results"
-msgstr ""
-
 msgid "The coding stage shows the time from the first commit to creating the merge request. The data will automatically be added here once you create your first merge request."
 msgstr ""
 

```

## Does this MR meet the acceptance criteria?

### Conformity

- [ ] [Changelog entry](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/changelog.html)

title: Return Last Deployment in Environment Dashboard
description:
## What does this MR do?

<!--

Describe in detail what your merge request does and why.

Are there any risks involved with the proposed change? What additional
test coverage is introduced to offset the risk?

Please keep this description up-to-date with any discussion that takes
place so that reviewers can understand your intent. This is especially
important if they didn't participate in the discussion.
